During Eclipse 3.3.1 Europa Fall startup the following error is seen in the workspace log file:
--------------------------------------------------
ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2 0 2007-10-11 11:18:28.737
!MESSAGE While loading class "org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.tasks.ui.ITaskHighlighter", thread "Thread[Worker-2,5,main]" timed out waiting (5000ms) for thread "Thread[Worker-0,5,main]" to finish starting bundle "update@plugins/org.eclipse.mylyn.tasks.ui_2.1.0.v20070927-0900.jar [77]". To avoid deadlock, thread "Thread[Worker-2,5,main]" is proceeding but "org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.tasks.ui.ITaskHighlighter" may not be fully initialized.
!STACK 0

        at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.DefaultClassLoader.findLocalClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:189)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findLocalClass(BundleLoader.java:340)

        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClassInternal(BundleLoader.java:405)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:369)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:357)
        at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.baseadaptor.DefaultClassLoader.loadClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:83)
...
-------------------------------------------

Detailed exception stack trace can be found in the attached workspace log file.
Also the configuration snapshot is attached.

I saw the same error(s) in the Eclipse Europa 3.3 release under both Linux (Fedora 6) and Windows XP OSes.

This is a duplicate of bug 188524 and should have no bad behavior.  The message in the log should be a warning and not an error (yellow icon instead of red).  If either of those statements is not true please let us know.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 188524 ***
